pci_instance_creation_name_rule: May contain numbers, letters, underscores, dashes and full stops only.
pci_instance_creation_instance_flex_desc: The Flex option opts for 50GB storage, providing faster snapshots and the ability to downgrade later on.
pci_instances_creation_quantity_label: Number of instances to be created
pci_instance_creation_quantity_rule: Under your current quota, you can create up to {{ quota }} simultaneous {{ type }} instance(s) for the {{ region }} region. <Link>View your quota</Link>
pci_instance_creation_select_deployment_: OVHcloud provides a robust and adaptable infrastructure, designed to meet a wide variety of use cases, with deployment models that balance budget control, redundancy, and fault tolerance. These options allow users to choose the approach that best suits their resilience, availability, and performance requirements.

1-AZ Region: These single-zone regions are optimal for workloads where cost optimisation is a priority. They are ideal for general needs such as storage, backups, or applications where availability requirements do not need multi-zone redundancy. They offer a good compromise between reliability, performance and cost control.

3-AZ Region: This model is designed for critical applications that require high availability and increased resilience. By replicating data across three separate availability zones, 3-AZ regions significantly reduce the risk of downtime, ensuring business continuity even in the event of an incident affecting one or more zones. This level of redundancy is particularly well-suited to demanding production environments. For more information, click here.

Local Zones: These infrastructure are specifically designed to meet needs that require ultra-low latency, or strict geographical constraints. By placing resources close to end users, Local Zones are ideal for use cases such as advanced computing, video games, content delivery, or solutions that require local regulatory compliance.
pci_instance_creation_select_localizatio: OVHcloud Public Cloud solution is available around the world via our network of datacentres located across several continents. The solution is accessible in Europe, North America and the Asia-Pacific region. Our goal is to extend the availability of our services to new geographic areas.
pci_instance_creation_flavor_unavailable: This model is not available in your selected region. <sb>However, you can select it, but you will need to choose another region for this model.</sb>
Your quota does not allow you to choose this instance model. Please increase your quota.
pci_instance_creation_select_new_region_: This model ({{ flavor }}) is not available in your selected region. You can still select it, but you will need to choose another available region for this model.
pci_instance_creation_select_image_help_: The images available in this step depend on the choices made in the previous steps, i.e. compatibility with the instance model and regional availability. For example, if you want to select a Windows operating system and there are no available Windows distributions, you must amend your choices in the previous steps.
pci_instance_creation_select_image_distr: To use the images, you will need to accept the supplier’s user licence agreement.
pci_instance_creation_select_flavor_help: OVHcloud offers a wide range of instances to meet your computing, memory, storage, and performance needs.
General Purpose Instances: these instances provide a balance between computing power, memory and storage. They are suitable for a wide range of applications and workloads.
Compute Optimised Instances: designed for compute-intensive workloads, such as data processing, modelling, simulation and rendering.
Memory Optimised Instances: suitable for memory-intensive applications, such as in-memory databases and data analytics. They have a high amount of RAM.
Storage Optimised Instances: ideal for workloads that require fast, high-capacity data storage, such as massive databases or streaming applications.
Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) Instances: equipped with graphic processing units (GPUs), these instances are designed for tasks such as machine learning, 3D visualisation, modelling and simulation.
Discovery Instances: specific instances for application development and testing, with shared resources to reduce costs.
pci_instance_creation_choose_availabilit: A default Availability Zone has been selected. You can customise this choice.
pci_instance_creation_availabilityZone_h: A 3-AZ region consists of three physically distinct but interconnected availability zones.
Each AZ corresponds to an independent data centre, enhancing the resilience and high availability of your deployments.
pci_instance_creation_select_sshKey_desc: An SSH key is required to connect to your service.
pci_instance_creation_select_sshKey_help: Understanding and using an SSH key
An SSH key allows you to securely connect to your instance without using a password.

It is based on two keys:
  • a public key, registered to your OVHcloud account,
  • a private key, stored on your computer and used to establish the connection.

Why use an SSH key?
  • Secure access to your instance (encrypted connection).
  • No need to enter a password each time you log in.
  • Compatible with all Linux and macOS systems (and Windows via WSL or PuTTY).

How to activate
  1. Create a pair of SSH keys on your local workstation (if you do not have one yet).
  2. Add your public key in the OVHcloud Control Panel. You can also directly add this public key after the instance is created.
  3. Select this key when deploying your instance.
  4. Once you have deployed the instance, log in via SSH with the corresponding private key.
Please refer to the complete guide on creating and using an SSH key.
pci_instance_creation_select_sshKey_miss: You do not have an SSH key, so you will not be able to connect to your server. Create a key to access your server.
pci_instance_creation_select_sshKey_add_: The SSH keys accepted are RSA, ECDSA and ED25519. Your SSH key will be available across all OVHcloud regions and datacentres in your project.
Your SSH key will be created at the end of the configuration process.
Name already in use, please choose a different name
pci_instance_creation_network_private_ne: Instances are in a private network. Internet or SSH access requires a Floating IP, a Gateway or an SSH-Proxy.
pci_instance_creation_network_private_he: A Private Network is an isolated and secure network that allows you to connect your instances to each other privately, without going through the Internet. This is useful to improve the security and performance of communications between your instances.

You can configure the port used for inter-network communication via the vLAN ID. You can also define the IP ranges concerned by this communication. This flexibility allows you to adapt the network configuration to your specific needs, ensuring optimal resource management and enhanced security.

Gateway

A Gateway allows you to provide outbound internet access to your instances from the selected private network. This can be useful for tasks such as security updates. The Gateway is incompatible with "Basic IP" public IPs.
pci_instance_creation_image_available_on: This image is available on other models.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_wa: Your private network will be created at the end of the configuration process. You can edit it.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_us: Using the same VLAN id for several private networks involves carefully managing the private IPs. Using a non-overlapping DHCP pool allocation can be one way to address this issue.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_vl: VLAN id 0 is used by default for other products, including non-Public Cloud products and solutions. Private IPs must be carefully managed
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_ci: Please enter a valid IP address
pci_instance_creation_network_add_new_vl: The vLAN ID must be between 0 and 4000. Please check the value entered before continuing.
pci_instance_creation_select_billing_cho: Pay for what you use, based on the real duration of use.
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_des: This feature allows you to automatically back up your instance, as often as you like.
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_hel: Protect your data and ensure the continuity of your infrastructure with automated backup mechanisms.

Automated backup by default

Each instance has an automated local backup, with two possible options: 7-day rotation or 14-day rotation. These backups enable you to quickly restore your environment in the event of an incident.

Custom backup and advanced management

If you want to set a custom rotation or schedule your backups as needed, use the Workflow Management section.

Create an automated backup of an instance

Replication to another datacentre

To strengthen your data resilience, you can enable backup replication to a remote datacentre. This provides additional security, and the ability to restore your instance to another region.
pci_instance_creation_backup_billing_lab: Each backup will be billed at: {{ price }} $t(pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_price_unit)
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_dis: The remote backup follows the same rotation as the local backup.
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_hel:
Where to find your backups

All your backups are accessible from: The management interface for your instance, the Backup & Workflow Management section.

View the complete backup management guide

pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_rot.predefined: A backup is performed every day between 10:00 PM and 6:00 AM (UTC) and the rotation maintains a history of the {{ numEntries }} most recent entries.
pci_instance_creation_backup_setting_rot.custom: Choose your own scheduling (UNIX Cron format), the number of rotations, and the maximum executions you wish.

pci_instance_creation_network_public_con: Public connectivity provides 2 levels of service:

Floating IP

Adding a Floating IP to the Gateway capabilities allows the instance to be accessible from outside. The Floating IP is persistent and can be kept as long as needed and re-allocated to another instance.

Basic IP

A Basic IP allows inbound and outbound connectivity with no usage restrictions. This IP is not persistent and is reallocated after the associated instance is deleted. It cannot be allocated to another instance.

pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.title: Assign public connectivity
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.description: Assigning a public IP address allows access to your instance from outside the OVHcloud network.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.basic_ip_label: Basic Public IP (Linked to the instance) - <sb>{{ price }}</sb>
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.basic_ip_description: A basic public IP is an address that does not persist beyond the lifetime of the resource.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.basic_ip_warning: We have detected a gateway on your private network, so this option is not available. Please choose or create a private network without a gateway.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.floating_ip_description: Reserving a floating IP address assigns the address to your project until you explicitly release it.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.floating_ip_warning: By selecting this option, we will assign you a {{ size }} sized gateway.
pci_instance_creation_network_add_public.floating_ip_unavailable_LZ_tooltip: Floating IPs are not available in localZones.

pci_instance_creation_network_gateway_un: The Gateway is not available in localZones.
pci_instance_creation_network_gateway_al: A Gateway is already assigned to the selected private network.
pci_instance_creation_discovery_project_: To finish creating your resource, you must activate your project.
pci_instance_creation_select_localizatio: Outgoing public network traffic for instances is included for all regions except the Asia-Pacific region. In this region, 1 TB/month of outgoing public traffic is included in each Public Cloud project. Above this quota, each additional GB of traffic is charged at €0.01. Incoming public network traffic is included in all cases, for all regions.
pci_instance_creation_network_full_priva:
This instance will not have public internet access. You won’t be able to connect to it or reach external services unless you use a bastion or add a gateway.

This improves security but limits connectivity. On your Windows instances, you must activate the license manually in order to access all services.

View guide

pci_instances_creations_in_progress: Instance creations are in progress, your services will be available shortly

pci_instance_onboarding_page_creation_pe: Your instance is being created, please wait a moment...

pci_instance_creation_flex_flavor.title: Flex Instances
pci_instance_creation_flex_flavor.disk_capacity: A flex instance is a single disk instance (50 GB) offering a faster process for snapshots.
pci_instance_creation_flex_flavor.resizing_explanation: It allows resizing to higher or lower models with fixed storage space, while classic models can only be resized to higher models.

pci_instance_creation_availabilityZone_h: Let OVHcloud automatically choose the AZ: This option simplifies deployment. The AZ is assigned automatically and you will find the AZ information at the end of your instance deployment. → Ideal for a first deployment or for non-redundant use.
You can choose from the three AZs available in the region. This allows you to distribute your instances across multiple AZs and thus implement your own redundancy mechanisms.
Learn more about multi-AZ and best practices →
pci_instance_creation_network_gateway_ba: A Basic Public IP has been detected on your Private Network, please create or select another Private Network to create a gateway.
pci_instance_creation_pricing_banner_bod: The prices of certain public cloud services are likely to change on April 1, 2026. For more details, please visit our pricing page.
